intro: Besleria brevisepala, commonly known as the short-stalked flame flower, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant, tubular flowers that come in shades of red, orange, and yellow. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, often reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a velvety texture, while its stems are hairy and branching. It thrives in warm, humid environments and is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and greenhouses.
